change.item: Encoded in EAD by Jodi Boyle

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collection documents the professional work of William J. Murray, who served as assistant administrative director of the New York State Department of Civil Service from 1946-1952 and then administrative director of the Department from 1952 until his retirement in 1971.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Born in Brooklyn, William John Murray (1908-1995) became an Albany resident in 1946. He served as assistant administrative director of the New York State Department of Civil Service from 1946-1952 and then administrative director of the Department from 1952 until his retirement in 1971.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains meeting minutes, correspondence, pocket calendars, legislative materials, speeches, reports, and subject files, the majority related to William J. Murray's service as assistant director and then director of the New York Department of Civil Service from 1946-1971. A significant portion of the collection is related to Murray’s “Role ONE Over” (RONEO) or daybooks. There are several files relating to consulting work Murray completed after his retirement from the Civil Service.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically. There are no series.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: J. Michael Murray donated the collection of his father's papers to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives in 2015.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, William J. Murray Papers, 1936-1978. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Murray Papers).

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The archivist transferred several monographs, including Staff Report on the Department of Civil Service, State of New York, Temporary State Commission on State Activities and The Administration of the New York State Civil Service Law to the book division of Special Collections. They will be catalogued and included in the University Libraries' Catalog.
